intro: Diflugossa celebica, commonly known as the Celebes diflugossa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
